author: potuz
content: We started thinking about this and most probably won't store it shortly after the merge, just keep the header and request the blocks from the EL by hash

author: terencechain
content: Still under discussion, but it's likely that Prysm will move to store only the header before merge. I would love to have this before the merge to avoid one DB migration

author: funnygiulio
content: would it be possible then to stop storing pre-transition blocks in EL though?

author: funnygiulio
content: the network of the beacon chain is much smaller, and after transition we can have the beacon chain handle block downloading and we wont have to send back old history from EL,  but just from CL

author: funnygiulio
content: or could this be an attack vector perhaps?

author: funnygiulio
content: basically you could download the state (up to the transition block) from IPFS and build the state forward using the beacon chain P2P network
